physical_appearance: A pair of Second World War puttees used by the British army is displayed. It is khaki in colour. There are two straps at the top of each gaiter, and two small buckles at the bottom. These fastening items are all brown in colour. There are no tears on both leggings.
sgcool_label_text: This pair of puttees were part of the British Army uniform during WWII. Soldiers wore them on the lower part of their legs, typically wound around from the ankle to the knee for protection and support.
subject_terms_1: soldier world wars worn costume accessories gaiters military uniforms
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939 - 1945 Great Britain. Army Leggings Military uniforms
